solveminmax

  • 4. Examples

4. ExamplesÂ¶

The module supports several kinds of equations that involve minimum and maximum. To begin with, it supports linear equations without min/max terms:

>>> from solveminmax import solver
>>> eq = "10*a = 150"
>>> solver.auto_solve(eq, "a")
FiniteSet(15)

It handles general minimum and maximum equations well and returns exact answers including Rationals and intervals:

>>> from solveminmax import solver
>>> eq_1 = "min(400, 600*a) = 400"
>>> solver.auto_solve(eq_1, "a")
Interval.Ropen(0.666666666666667, 1)
>>> eq_2 = "min(500, 600*a) + max(400, 500*a) = 500"
>>> solver.auto_solve(eq_2, "eq")
FiniteSet(1/6)

For equations that have no solutions, the module returns None:

>>> from solveminmax import solver
>>> eq_1 = "min(400*a, 100) = 500"
>>> print(solver.auto_solve(eq_1, "a"))
None

It also supports basic error-handling, such as:

>>> from solveminmax import solver
>>> eq_1 = "min(20*a) = 300"
>>> solver.auto_solve(eq_1, "a")
ValueError: MinMax terms malformed!
